bill_title: to authorize the Board of Regents to construct a softball complex at the University of South Dakota and to make an appropriation therefor.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize the Board of Regents to construct a softball complex at the University of South Dakota and to make an appropriation therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The Board of Regents may contract for the construction, completion, finishing, equipping, and maintaining of the softball and soccer complex at the University of South Dakota, Vermillion, including utilities, furnishings, architectural and engineering services, and site preparation and the construction of sidewalks and driveways and landscaping the grounds of that facility, all for the estimated cost of four hundred nine thousand dollars ($409,000), to be paid from other funds under the control of the Board of Regents, from gifts and grants to the University of South Dakota specifically for this purpose, including certain funds to be provided by the city of Vermillion, and from financing provided pursuant to chapter 13-53, all of which are hereby appropriated to the Board of Regents for the purposes of this Act. Section 2. The Board of Regents may accept, transfer, and expend any funds obtained for these purposes from federal sources, gifts, contributions, or any other source, all of which shall be deemed appropriated to this construction. Section 3. The design and construction of these modifications shall be under the general charge and supervision of the Bureau of Administration as provided in chapter 5-14. The commissioner of the Bureau of Administration and the executive director of the Board of Regents shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize the Board of Regents to construct a softball complex at the University of South Dakota and to make an appropriation therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The Board of Regents may contract for the construction, completion, finishing, equipping, and maintaining of the softball and soccer complex at the University of South Dakota, Vermillion, including utilities, furnishings, architectural and engineering services, and site preparation and the construction of sidewalks and driveways and landscaping the grounds of that facility, all for the estimated cost of five hundred forty-five thousand dollars ($545,000), to be paid from other funds under the control of the Board of Regents, from gifts and grants to the University of South Dakota specifically for this purpose, including certain funds to be provided by the city of Vermillion, and from financing provided pursuant to chapter 13-53, all of which are hereby appropriated to the Board of Regents for the purposes of this Act. Section 2. The Board of Regents may accept, transfer, and expend any funds obtained for these purposes from federal sources, gifts, contributions, or any other source, all of which shall be deemed appropriated to this construction. Section 3. The design and construction of these modifications shall be under the general charge and supervision of the Bureau of Administration as provided in chapter 5-14. The commissioner of the Bureau of Administration and the executive director of the Board of Regents shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. BILL HISTORY 1/13/98 First read in House and referred to Appropriations. H.J. 22 1/27/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/27/98 Appropriations Deferred to another day. 1/28/98 Appropriations Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 7, NAYS 3. H.J. 270
